overview: Risk management is a key business activity that impacts the full range of organisational activities and functional areas across the enterprise. This subject surveys a spectrum of business risks from operational to strategic risks. It provides a foundation in enterprise risk management principles, tools and techniques such as risk scenario planning.

assessments.description: Group project (normally in groups of 5 students). 5000 words

Winter Term.Contact hours: 36 hours, comprising of three 3 hour seminars per week

Prescribed texts: Online readings available via the LMS.

Subject notes: This subject is open to all postgraduate students in the Graduate School of Business and Economics. Students are generally expected to have work experience and a solid foundation in business and management.
